intro: Stylidium leptorrhizum var. pilosum, commonly known as the hairy sun-orchid, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant features a hairy stem and leaves, which contribute to its distinctive appearance. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. This variety is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient and adaptive species.
